issue.title: Cached metadata exists for deleted remote
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I've added test remote by copying LVFS remote config file into `/var/lib/fwupd/remotes.d/test-lvfs.conf`, did some tests and removed configuration file for remote. Stalled metadata exists:
```
/var/lib/fwupd/metadata/test-lvfs:
total 940
-rw-r--r--. 1 fwupd fwupd 954615 Oct 19 06:19 metadata.xml.gz
-rw-r--r--. 1 fwupd fwupd   2236 Oct 19 06:19 metadata.xml.gz.jcat
```

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. `cp /etc/fwupd/remotes.d/lvfs.conf /var/lib/fwupd/remotes.d/test-lvfs.conf`
2. `fwupdmgr refresh`
3. `rm /var/lib/fwupd/remotes.d/test-lvfs.conf`

**Expected behavior**
Metadata cached for removed remote should be wiped out.

**fwupd version information**

```shell
fwupdmgr --version
compile   org.freedesktop.fwupd         1.9.6
compile   com.hughsie.libxmlb           0.3.11
compile   com.hughsie.libjcat           0.1.8
compile   org.freedesktop.gusb          0.4.5
runtime   org.freedesktop.gusb          0.4.5
runtime   org.kernel                    5.15.135-20747-gb9ef44e9cff8
runtime   org.freedesktop.fwupd         1.9.6
```

**Additional questions**

- Operating system and version:
ChromeOS 120
- Have you tried rebooting?
Yes
- Is this a regression?
No

comment.body: @superm1 how do you feel about this? I'm hesitant to delete files like this -- I don't think it's valid to have /var/lib shared on something like NFS -- but it does feel a bit magic.

commits.message:
logitech-bulkcontroller: Send the Olson location rather than the timezone

This fixes:

    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Timezone: GMT is not an Olson ID

comment.body: Previously in file `fu-vli-usbhub-firmware.c`, line 117,  `fu_memread_uint16_safe()`, we need to read 2 bytes from buffer to adr_ofs; now in file `fu-vli-usbhub-firmware.c`, line 100,  we need to read 3 bytes from buffer to adr_ofs. We thought `fu_memread_uint24_safe()` would work for this purpose. If not, can you help us find a better approach?

issue.title: Fail to do end-to-end testiing
issue.body:
**Describe the question**
i'm engineer at Kinet-ic responsible for fwupd. I'm relatively new to fwupd, so I'd like to start by familiarizing myself with it through testing. Currently, I've been successful in offline testing using fwupdtool, but I'm facing difficulties with end-to-end online testing. 

**fwupd version information**
I've cloned source code from [](https://github.com/fwupd/fwupd.git) and checkout branch to wip/kinetic/latest that is a  per-existing branch. Then, I followed build step to build local fwupd successfully  and finish to install.

OS: Ubuntu 22.04

```shell
$fwupdmgr --version
compile   org.freedesktop.fwupd         1.9.3
compile   com.hughsie.libxmlb           0.3.6
compile   com.hughsie.libjcat           0.1.9
runtime   org.freedesktop.fwupd-efi     1.0
compile   org.freedesktop.gusb          0.3.10
runtime   com.dell.libsmbios            2.4
runtime   org.freedesktop.gusb          0.3.10
runtime   org.freedesktop.fwupd         1.9.3
runtime   org.kernel                    6.5.7-060507-generic
```
Check plugins
```shell
$fwupdmgr get-plugins 
......
kinetic_dp:
  Flags:                • Enabled
......
```
Check devices
```shell
$fwupdmgr get-devices
├─KTM50X0:
│     Device ID:          d762543f8c20f636e6fff031a000078d3e10c600
│     Summary:            DisplayPort Protocol Converter
│     Current version:    0.013.09
│     Vendor:             Kinetic Technologies (DRM_DP_AUX_DEV:0x329A, DRM_DP_AUX_DEV:0x8086)
│     GUIDs:              e08317e3-a3c8-57b2-a85c-fd3f884bed94 ← MST\VEN_8086&FAM_JAGUAR
│                         23c90ea0-0bdf-5abe-88b4-8f46e66eecec ← MST\VEN_8086&FAM_JAGUAR&CID_KTM50X0
│     Device Flags:       • Updatable
```
**End-to-end Test**
I attempted to downgrade device version to v0.013.09 and uploaded the latest version(0.013.18) FW to LVFS. Following the end-to-end step

1. Download kinet_ic-embargo.conf
2. Copy the file to /etc/fwupd/remote.d/
3. Execute 
```shell
$fwupdmgr refresh --force
WARNING: This package has not been validated, it may not work properly.
Updating lvfs
Downloading…             [           |                           ]
Successfully downloaded new metadata: 1 local device supported
```
4. Execute 
```shell
$fwupdmgr update
WARNING: This package has not been validated, it may not work properly.
Devices with no available firmware updates: 
 • KTM50X0
 • SSDSCKKW256G8
 • System Firmware
Devices with the latest available firmware version:
 • UEFI dbx

``` 
Is it because the version of fwupd is too old, causing it not to fit in LVFS, or did I miis any steps?

comment.body:
I moved ```kinet_ic-embargo.conf``` from /etc/fwupd/remotes.d/ to /usr/local/etc/fwupd/remotes.d/```.
Executed 
````shell
$fwupdmgr refersh
WARNING: This package has not been validated, it may not work properly.
Updating kinet_ic-embargo
Downloading…             [***************************************]
Updating lvfs
Downloading…             [************************************** ]
Successfully downloaded new metadata: 2 local devices supported

````
fwupdmgr is able to get remote ID:```kinet_ic-embargo```!!!
But fwupdmgr update still fail to update
```shell
$fwupdmgr update
WARNING: This package has not been validated, it may not work properly.
Devices with no available firmware updates: 
 • SSDSCKKW256G8
 • System Firmware
╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║ Upgrade KTM50X0 from 0.013.09 to 0.013.18?                                   ║
╠══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╣
║ The vendor did not supply any release notes.                                 ║
║                                                                              ║
║ KTM50X0 and all connected devices may not be usable while updating.          ║
╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝
Perform operation? [Y|n]: y
Authenticating…          [***************************************]
Could not check for auth: GDBus.Error:org.freedesktop.PolicyKit1.Error.Failed: Action org.freedesktop.fwupd.update-hotplug-trusted is not registered
```

issue.title: Fail to do end-to-end testiing
issue.body:
**Describe the question**
i'm engineer at Kinet-ic responsible for fwupd. I'm relatively new to fwupd, so I'd like to start by familiarizing myself with it through testing. Currently, I've been successful in offline testing using fwupdtool, but I'm facing difficulties with end-to-end online testing. 

**fwupd version information**
I've cloned source code from [](https://github.com/fwupd/fwupd.git) and checkout branch to wip/kinetic/latest that is a  per-existing branch. Then, I followed build step to build local fwupd successfully  and finish to install.

OS: Ubuntu 22.04

```shell
$fwupdmgr --version
compile   org.freedesktop.fwupd         1.9.3
compile   com.hughsie.libxmlb           0.3.6
compile   com.hughsie.libjcat           0.1.9
runtime   org.freedesktop.fwupd-efi     1.0
compile   org.freedesktop.gusb          0.3.10
runtime   com.dell.libsmbios            2.4
runtime   org.freedesktop.gusb          0.3.10
runtime   org.freedesktop.fwupd         1.9.3
runtime   org.kernel                    6.5.7-060507-generic
```
Check plugins
```shell
$fwupdmgr get-plugins 
......
kinetic_dp:
  Flags:                • Enabled
......
```
Check devices
```shell
$fwupdmgr get-devices
├─KTM50X0:
│     Device ID:          d762543f8c20f636e6fff031a000078d3e10c600
│     Summary:            DisplayPort Protocol Converter
│     Current version:    0.013.09
│     Vendor:             Kinetic Technologies (DRM_DP_AUX_DEV:0x329A, DRM_DP_AUX_DEV:0x8086)
│     GUIDs:              e08317e3-a3c8-57b2-a85c-fd3f884bed94 ← MST\VEN_8086&FAM_JAGUAR
│                         23c90ea0-0bdf-5abe-88b4-8f46e66eecec ← MST\VEN_8086&FAM_JAGUAR&CID_KTM50X0
│     Device Flags:       • Updatable
```
**End-to-end Test**
I attempted to downgrade device version to v0.013.09 and uploaded the latest version(0.013.18) FW to LVFS. Following the end-to-end step

1. Download kinet_ic-embargo.conf
2. Copy the file to /etc/fwupd/remote.d/
3. Execute 
```shell
$fwupdmgr refresh --force
WARNING: This package has not been validated, it may not work properly.
Updating lvfs
Downloading…             [           |                           ]
Successfully downloaded new metadata: 1 local device supported
```
4. Execute 
```shell
$fwupdmgr update
WARNING: This package has not been validated, it may not work properly.
Devices with no available firmware updates: 
 • KTM50X0
 • SSDSCKKW256G8
 • System Firmware
Devices with the latest available firmware version:
 • UEFI dbx

``` 
Is it because the version of fwupd is too old, causing it not to fit in LVFS, or did I miis any steps?

comment.body:
Yes, I have. I downloaded and copied ```kinet_ic-embargo.conf``` from website to my local environment. ```/etc/fwupd/remotes.d/```
I also checked  the configuration ```Enable=true``` in ```kinet_ic-embargo.conf```.

```shell
 • SSDSCKKW256G8
 • System Firmware
Devices with the latest available firmware version:
 • UEFI dbx

``` 
Is it because the version of fwupd is too old, causing it not to fit in LVFS, or did I miis any steps?

comment.body: Did you not enable your embargo remote?
